jsar Maven Plugin
Last Published: 2011-11-07  | Version: 1.5
jsar Maven Plugin
Parent Project
  • JavaScript Framework
Project Documentation
  • Project Information
  • Project Reports

jsar:jsar

Full name:

com.github.jlgrock.javascript-framework:jsar-maven-plugin:1.5:jsar

Description:

Build a JSAR package from the current project. This is essentially a modified JAR plugin, since Plexus offers no way to extend classes from other packages from maven dependencies, this is copied over in its entirety and edited.

Attributes:

  • Requires a Maven 2.0 project to be executed.
  • Requires dependency resolution of artifacts in scope: runtime.
  • Binds by default to the lifecycle phase: package.

Required Parameters

Name Type Since Description
finalName String - Name of the generated JSAR.
Default value is: ${project.build.finalName}.
outputDirectory File - Directory containing the generated JSAR.

Optional Parameters

Name Type Since Description
archive MavenArchiveConfiguration - The archive configuration to use. See Maven Archiver Reference.
classifier String - Classifier to add to the artifact generated. If given, the artifact will be an attachment instead.
debugFilename String - This will default to compiledFilename + "-debug" if not overridden
Default value is: ${project.build.finalName}-debug.js.
excludes String[] - List of files to exclude. Specified as fileset patterns which are relative to the input directory whose contents is being packaged into the JSAR.
forceCreation boolean - Whether creating the archive should be forced.
Default value is: false.
frameworkTargetDirectory File - The directory to place compiled files into.
Default value is: ${project.build.directory}${file.separator}javascriptFramework.
includes String[] - List of files to include. Specified as fileset patterns which are relative to the input directory whose contents is being packaged into the JSAR.
useDefaultManifestFile boolean 2.2 Set this to true to enable the use of the defaultManifestFile.
Default value is: false.

Parameter Details

archive:

The archive configuration to use. See Maven Archiver Reference.
  • Type: org.apache.maven.archiver.MavenArchiveConfiguration
  • Required: No

classifier:

Classifier to add to the artifact generated. If given, the artifact will be an attachment instead.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No

debugFilename:

This will default to compiledFilename + "-debug" if not overridden
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • Default: ${project.build.finalName}-debug.js

excludes:

List of files to exclude. Specified as fileset patterns which are relative to the input directory whose contents is being packaged into the JSAR.
  • Type: java.lang.String[]
  • Required: No

finalName:

Name of the generated JSAR.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: Yes
  • Expression: ${jar.finalName}
  • Default: ${project.build.finalName}

forceCreation:

Whether creating the archive should be forced.
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${jar.forceCreation}
  • Default: false

frameworkTargetDirectory:

The directory to place compiled files into.
  • Type: java.io.File
  • Required: No
  • Default: ${project.build.directory}${file.separator}javascriptFramework

includes:

List of files to include. Specified as fileset patterns which are relative to the input directory whose contents is being packaged into the JSAR.
  • Type: java.lang.String[]
  • Required: No

outputDirectory:

Directory containing the generated JSAR.
  • Type: java.io.File
  • Required: Yes
  • Expression: ${project.build.directory}

useDefaultManifestFile:

Set this to true to enable the use of the defaultManifestFile.
  • Type: boolean
  • Since: 2.2
  • Required: No
  • Expression: ${jar.useDefaultManifestFile}
  • Default: false
